cold_snaps.status: No cold snap is happening right now.  There have been 6 such events this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: There is no heatwave at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwaves, with an average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Today ranked 8th for the heaviest total rainfall during a storm, dropping 13.04mm over the storm duration of 7.9 hours with a maximum rate of 8.6mm per hour.  On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 27.64mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 15.9 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The highest ranked rain rate was registered today with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  7.99mm of rain fell during the storm's 2.0 hours length.

storm.status: Rain fell for 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024 creating a new record.  The storm produced a total of 24.56mm at a maximum intensity of 6.4mm per hour.
Storm conditions are present now.  It is the first storm in the region since September 03, 2025.

top_10_rainy.status: Currently experiencing a significant rainy period, ranked 4th longest since August 2024.  So far, it has lasted 9 consecutive days beginning August 26, 2025.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was July 18, 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (207°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 Oct 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen was 1754 miles on 21 Oct 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 80.64 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 Oct 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.4 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1661 m) and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 73.7m lower than yesterday, 557.6m lower than the past week, 1661.5m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 713m to 1594m and averaged 993.3m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; temperatures should feel nicely warm. Also, very clammy and humid and very little to no wind will be present. Light to moderate rain is forecast, occasional overcast conditions, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather could become unsettled.
